description: Real-time monitoring of energy trading data: prices, plant status, and API health

targets.rawSql: SELECT value FROM energy_prices WHERE tariff_type = 'integrated' ORDER BY start_timestamp DESC LIMIT 1;
SELECT value FROM energy_prices WHERE tariff_type = 'grid' ORDER BY start_timestamp DESC LIMIT 1;
SELECT value FROM energy_prices WHERE tariff_type = 'electricity' ORDER BY start_timestamp DESC LIMIT 1;
SELECT count(*) as total FROM energy_prices;

panels.description: All tariff types over time (15-minute intervals)

targets.rawSql:
SELECT 
  start_timestamp as time,
  tariff_type as metric,
  value
FROM energy_prices
WHERE start_timestamp >= NOW() - INTERVAL '7 days'
ORDER BY start_timestamp;

panels.title: Energy Prices Over Time (Quarter-Hourly)

panels.description: Current operational status of the plant

targets.rawSql: SELECT operational_status FROM plant_status ORDER BY timestamp DESC LIMIT 1;

panels.title: Plant Status

targets.rawSql: SELECT active_power_mw FROM plant_status ORDER BY timestamp DESC LIMIT 1;
SELECT voltage_kv FROM plant_status ORDER BY timestamp DESC LIMIT 1;
SELECT wind_speed_kmh FROM plant_status ORDER BY timestamp DESC LIMIT 1;
SELECT reactive_power_mvar FROM plant_status ORDER BY timestamp DESC LIMIT 1;

SELECT 
  signal_name,
  description,
  signal_date,
  start_timestamp::time as start_time,
  end_timestamp::time as end_time,
  (end_timestamp - start_timestamp) as duration
FROM control_signals
ORDER BY signal_date DESC, start_timestamp DESC
LIMIT 20;

panels.description: Overall API success rate in the last 24 hours

targets.rawSql:
SELECT 
  ROUND(100.0 * SUM(CASE WHEN success THEN 1 ELSE 0 END) / COUNT(*), 2) as success_rate
FROM api_health_logs
WHERE checked_at > NOW() - INTERVAL '24 hours';

panels.title: API Success Rate (24h)

targets.rawSql: SELECT COUNT(*) as count FROM api_health_logs WHERE success = true;
SELECT COUNT(*) as count FROM api_health_logs WHERE success = false;

panels.description: Average response time across all endpoints

targets.rawSql: SELECT ROUND(AVG(response_time_ms), 2) as avg_time FROM api_health_logs;

panels.title: Avg Response Time

targets.rawSql: SELECT MAX(checked_at) as last_check FROM api_health_logs;
SELECT * FROM v_api_health_summary ORDER BY endpoint;

title: Energy Trading Monitor
